Package com.rds_software.customers.menarini.projects.odp.types

Type definitions and enumerations for the ODP (Ordine di Pagamento) system.

See: Description

  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    OdpSearchResultColumnType
    Represents the columns in the ODP search results data grid.
    OdpStateType
    Represents the state of an ODP (Ordine di Pagamento) in its lifecycle.
    PaymentType
    Represents the type of payment method for an ODP (Ordine di Pagamento).
    RoleType
    Represents the role type of a user in the ODP (Ordine di Pagamento) workflow.

Package com.rds_software.customers.menarini.projects.odp.types Description

Type definitions and enumerations for the ODP (Ordine di Pagamento) system.

Overview

This package contains enumeration types that define the valid values for various properties in the ODP system. These enums provide type safety, ensure data integrity, and encode business rules directly in the type system.

Enumerations

OdpStateType

OdpStateType defines the lifecycle states of a payment order:

  • TEMPLATE - Master template for creating new ODPs
  • DRAFT - Being edited, not yet submitted for approval
  • WAITING_AUTH_SIGNER_1 - Pending first signer authorization
  • WAITING_AUTH_SIGNER_2 - Pending second signer authorization
  • WAITING_AUTH_PAYER - Pending payer authorization
  • PAYABLE - Fully authorized and ready for payment
  • REJECTED - Rejected during authorization workflow

Each state has associated behavior flags:

  • isOdpCanBeEdited() - Whether ODPs in this state can be modified
  • isOdpCanBeApproved() - Whether ODPs in this state can be approved/rejected
  • isOdpEligibleForApproval() - Whether ODPs can be submitted for approval

RoleType

RoleType defines user roles with their associated permissions:

  • PROPOSER - Can create, update, and delete ODPs (canCreate, canUpdate, canDelete)
  • SIGNER_1 - Can approve/reject ODPs at first authorization level (canApprove)
  • SIGNER_2 - Can approve/reject ODPs at second authorization level (canApprove)
  • PAYER - Can approve/reject and execute payments (canApprove, canExecutePayment)

PaymentType

PaymentType defines the types of payments that can be processed.

OdpSearchResultColumnType

OdpSearchResultColumnType defines the columns available for sorting search results in the ODP grid.

Design Patterns

Behavior-Enriched Enums

The enums in this package follow the "behavior-enriched enum" pattern, where each enum constant carries associated data (flags, permissions) and provides methods to query that data. This encapsulates business rules within the type definition.

Type Safety

Using enums instead of string constants or integer codes provides:

  • Compile-time type checking
  • IDE auto-completion support
  • Prevention of invalid values
  • Self-documenting code

Usage Examples

Checking State Capabilities


 Odp odp = ...;
 OdpStateType state = odp.getStato();

 if (state.isOdpCanBeEdited()) {
     // Allow user to edit the ODP
 }

 if (state.isOdpCanBeApproved()) {
     // Show approval buttons
 }

 if (state.isOdpEligibleForApproval()) {
     // Show "Submit for Approval" button
 }

Checking Role Permissions


 OdpUser user = ...;
 RoleType role = user.getRole();

 if (role.canCreate()) {
     // Show "Create New ODP" button
 }

 if (role.canApprove()) {
     // User can participate in authorization workflow
 }

 if (role.canExecutePayment()) {
     // Show payment execution options
 }

State Transitions


 // Submitting a DRAFT for approval
 if (odp.getStato() == OdpStateType.DRAFT &&
     odp.getStato().isOdpEligibleForApproval()) {
     odpService.submitOdpForApproval(odp.getId(), userId);
     // ODP state transitions to WAITING_AUTH_SIGNER_1
 }

Validation and Business Rules

The enums work in conjunction with utility classes to enforce business rules:

  • State-based edit restrictions are enforced by OdpStateType.isOdpCanBeEdited()
  • Role-based permissions are checked via RoleType permission methods
  • Authorization workflow logic uses state and role information together
Version:
3.0
Author:
RDS Software
